Sentencas: in situ high-temperature X-ray diffraction and thermal gravimetric-differential thermal analysis on room-temperature powder, as well as X-ray diffraction, Raman spectroscopy, and transmission electron microscopy on quenched powder, were applied to study crystal structure and phase transformations in Ba2Bi0.1Sc0.2Co1.7O6-x (BBSC).
Titulo: Deactivation and Regeneration of Oxygen Reduction Reactivity on Double Perovskite Ba2Bi0.1Sc0.2Co1.7O6-x Cathode for Intermediate-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Heating BBSC in air to over 800 degrees C produces a pure cubic phase with space group Fm (3) over barm (no. 225), and cooling down below 800 degrees C leads to a mixture of three noncubic phases including an unknown phase between 200 and 650 degrees C, a 2H hexagonal BaCoO3 with space group P63/mmc (no. 194) between 600 and 800 degrees C, and an intermediate phase at 800 degrees C. These three phases exist concurrently with the major cubic phase.
Titulo: Deactivation and Regeneration of Oxygen Reduction Reactivity on Double Perovskite Ba2Bi0.1Sc0.2Co1.7O6-x Cathode for Intermediate-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The weight gain and loss between 300 and 900 degrees C suggest the occurrence of cobalt reduction, oxidation, and disproportion reactions with dominant reduction reaction at above 600 degrees C.
Titulo: Deactivation and Regeneration of Oxygen Reduction Reactivity on Double Perovskite Ba2Bi0.1Sc0.2Co1.7O6-x Cathode for Intermediate-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The thermal expansion of BBSC was also examined by dilatometry.
Titulo: Deactivation and Regeneration of Oxygen Reduction Reactivity on Double Perovskite Ba2Bi0.1Sc0.2Co1.7O6-x Cathode for Intermediate-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: BBSC has a highly temperature-dependent thermal expansion coefficient which relates well with its structure evolution.
Titulo: Deactivation and Regeneration of Oxygen Reduction Reactivity on Double Perovskite Ba2Bi0.1Sc0.2Co1.7O6-x Cathode for Intermediate-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Furthermore, the oxygen reduction reaction (ORR) of BBSC was probed by symmetrical cell and three-electrode configurations.
Titulo: Deactivation and Regeneration of Oxygen Reduction Reactivity on Double Perovskite Ba2Bi0.1Sc0.2Co1.7O6-x Cathode for Intermediate-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The presence of hexagonal phase at 700 degrees C rarely affects the ORR performance of BBSC as evidenced by a slight increase of its area-specific resistance (ASR) value following 48 h of testing in this three-electrode configuration.
Titulo: Deactivation and Regeneration of Oxygen Reduction Reactivity on Double Perovskite Ba2Bi0.1Sc0.2Co1.7O6-x Cathode for Intermediate-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: This observation is in contrast to the commonly held point of view that noncubic phase deteriorates performance of perovskite compounds (especially in oxygen transport applications).
Titulo: Deactivation and Regeneration of Oxygen Reduction Reactivity on Double Perovskite Ba2Bi0.1Sc0.2Co1.7O6-x Cathode for Intermediate-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Moreover, cathodic polarization treatment, for example, current discharge from BBSC (tested in three-electrode configuration), can be utilized to recover the original ORR performance.
Titulo: Deactivation and Regeneration of Oxygen Reduction Reactivity on Double Perovskite Ba2Bi0.1Sc0.2Co1.7O6-x Cathode for Intermediate-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The cubic structure seems to be retained on the cathodic polarization-the normal cathode operating mode in fuel cells.
Titulo: Deactivation and Regeneration of Oxygen Reduction Reactivity on Double Perovskite Ba2Bi0.1Sc0.2Co1.7O6-x Cathode for Intermediate-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Stable 72-h performance of BBSC in cathodic polarization mode further confirms that despite the presence of phase impurities, BBSC still demonstrates good performance between 500 and 700 degrees C, the desired intermediate operating temperature in solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Deactivation and Regeneration of Oxygen Reduction Reactivity on Double Perovskite Ba2Bi0.1Sc0.2Co1.7O6-x Cathode for Intermediate-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
